questions.text: Which of the following features would you not expect to see in a patient with West syndrome?
A patient with HIV infection that has progressed to AIDS had been treated previously for cytomegalovirus pneumonia. For which additional CMV disease would this patient also be at risk?
Plasmapheresis is the mainstay of treatment in patients with which of the following?
Which among the following options is the most common cause of death in patients undergoing blood transfusions?
Which of the following serological markers is positive in ulcerative colitis?

A 35-year-old woman presented with difficulty in activities like climbing stairs, getting up from a chair, and combing hair. She is a known case of ovarian cancer. The following finding was noted on examination. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 60-year-old man with history of gout is now diagnosed with hypertension. Which of the following is the drug of choice for this patient?

A 35-year-old patient with Crohn’s disease presents with back pain and stiffness. The physician suspects ankylosing spondylitis and orders an MRI for evaluation. Which of the following joints will be the earliest to be involved?
Which is the most common cardiac valvular lesion seen in patients with rheumatoid arthritis?

A 63-year-old man presented with fever, malaise, skin rashes, and arthralgia. On further evaluation, his serology was positive for ANA and anti-histone antibodies. Use of which of the following drugs could have led to this condition?
Which of the following would you not expect to see in a patient diagnosed with Felty syndrome?
What type of hypersensitivity reaction is seen in systemic lupus erythematosus?
A 35-year-old patient receiving anti-tubercular therapy has been recently diagnosed with gout. Which of the following statements is incorrect about this condition?

options.label: D
options.text: Most commonly involves the first MTP joint

questions.correct_answer: A. The crystals are positively birefringent

questions.text: A 9-year-old boy presents to the ER with colicky abdominal pain. His mother tells you that he refuses to walk due to knee pain. On examination, palpable purpura is noted. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a component of CREST syndrome?
An 11-year-old child diagnosed with acute rheumatic fever and having no valvular pathology comes to your clinic. What is the duration of prophylaxis given to this child?

A woman presents with altered sensorium, breathlessness, hypotension, and bradycardia. Examination revealed non-pitting edema of the extremities. She has a long-standing history of weight gain, constipation, cold intolerance, and menorrhagia. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents with cough, cold, fever, and malaise associated with weight loss and ascites. A radiograph of the chest is shown below. Ascitic fluid analysis showed elevated adenosine deaminase. Which of the following is the next step in management?

options.label: B
options.text: Start ATT after laparotomy and stricture removal

questions.text: The patient has a fever, cough, and cold. The chest x-ray is given below. What will be the examination finding in the infrascapular region?
What is the most common genetic abnormality seen in patients with recurrent history of venous thrombosis?

A patient presents with chronic diarrhea, bloating sensation, and weight loss. History is significant for stools that are bulky, pale, foul-smelling, and difficult to flush. Further testing reveals fecal fat excretion of 8.2g/day. Which of the following would be a differential diagnosis?
Which of the following is false regarding patients with Bernard-Soulier syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Platelet aggregation tests with epinephrine and ADP are normal

questions.correct_answer: B. Ristocetin aggregation test is normal

questions.text: What is the most common cytogenetic abnormality in patients with polycythemia vera?
What is the earliest radiographic feature of Crohn’s disease?
An HIV-positive individual presents with the following finding. What is the diagnosis & WHO staging?
Thrombocytopenia, eczema and recurrent infections are seen in:

A patient with diabetes mellitus for the past 5 years presents with vomiting and abdominal pain. She is non-compliant with medication and appears dehydrated. Investigations revealed a blood sugar value of 500 mg/dL and the presence of ketone bodies. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Intravenous fluids with long acting insulin

questions.correct_answer: D. Intravenous fluids with regular insulin

questions.text: A female patient presents to you with a unilateral headache. It is associated with nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. What is the drug of choice for acute management?
A hypertensive patient who is non-compliant with medication presents to you with sudden onset breathlessness. A chest X-ray was done, which is shown below. How will you manage this patient?

A patient presents to you with fever, night sweats, ptosis, and bilateral facial nerve palsy. Investigations showed leukocytosis and bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
How many goals does the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) comprise of?
Which of the following is not transmitted by lice?
An intern sustains a needlestick injury while drawing blood from a Hepatitis B positive patient. Assuming he has been infected, which among the following will be the first to rise?
Which of the following is true about the National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular Diseases and Stroke?

options.label: A
options.text: No separate centres for stroke, DM and cancer

options.label: B
options.text: Implementation in over 10 districts in 5 states

options.label: D
options.text: Subcentre has facility for diagnosis and treatment

questions.correct_answer: C. District hospital has specialized facilities

questions.text: Identify the organization that has the given emblem:

options.label: A
options.text: National Vector Borne Disease Control Programme

options.label: D
options.text: National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular Disease, and Stroke

questions.correct_answer: A. National Vector Borne Disease Control Programme

questions.text: Which of the following methods of purification of water cannot be used on a large scale?
An ASHA worker is offering services under the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan in her village. All of the following services will be provided by her except:

options.label: D
options.text: Information, education, communication and public awareness

questions.text: Droplet precaution and isolation is to be done for all of the following conditions except:
A banker who is scheduled to travel to Congo is advised to take the yellow fever vaccine. What is the flight range of the mosquito which transmits this disease?
Which of the following is not a component of the global hunger index (GHI)?

options.label: D
options.text: Percentage of undernourished children under 5 years

questions.text: Which of the following steps of disaster management is in correct order?
questions.correct_answer: C. Disaster impact- Response - Rehabilitation – Mitigation

questions.text: Project “Axshya” is in relation to controlling which of the following disease?
Given below is an instrument which is used to measure air humidity. Identify the instrument.
Which vaccine is crucial for pregnant women to protect their newborns from pertussis (whooping cough)?
Which vaccine is typically given to newborns within 24 hours of birth to prevent a specific type of hepatitis?
Which of the following is not indicated in Acute Intermittent Porphyria?
Identify the instrument shown in the image below.
Which anesthetic agent is most commonly associated with postoperative delirium and hallucinations due to its unique pharmacological properties?
A 51-year-old patient with COVID-19 requires supplemental oxygen. Which color of the oxygen cylinder should be used to deliver oxygen to this patient?
questions.correct_answer: A. Black body with white shoulder

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman undergoes general anesthesia for an emergency appendectomy in a hospital in Mumbai. Shortly after the administration of halothane and succinylcholine, she develops a rapid rise in end-tidal CO2, muscle rigidity, and a high fever. Suspecting a serious complication, the anesthesiologist should immediately consider which of the following conditions?
Which of the following is not a contraindication for bariatric surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Failure to lose weight despite psychotherapy

questions.correct_answer: A. Failure to lose weight despite psychotherapy

questions.text: A patient presents with a hernia medial to the inferior epigastric artery. What is the most likely diagnosis and appropriate management for the same?

options.label: B
options.text: Direct hernia and Lichtenstein mesh repair

options.label: D
options.text: Indirect hernia and Lichtenstein mesh repair

questions.correct_answer: B. Direct hernia and Lichtenstein mesh repair

questions.text: A patient presents with pain in the right upper quadrant on the second postoperative day following a cholecystectomy. Evaluation reveals a collection in the subhepatic space. A bile leak was suspected. Which of the following is the best investigation for this patient?

A 67-year-old patient with a history of thromboembolic stroke is currently taking aspirin and warfarin. He is complaining of a headache and appears confused after a fall in the toilet last night. NCCT of the head was done. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: B
options.text: Vitamin K, fresh frozen plasma and neurosurgery consultation

questions.correct_answer: B. Vitamin K, fresh frozen plasma and neurosurgery consultation

questions.text: Which of the following is not a contraindication for breast conservative surgery

options.label: A
options.text: Tumor size < 4cm, with N1 axillary metastasis

options.label: B
options.text: Tumor more than the size of the breast

questions.correct_answer: A. Tumor size < 4cm, with N1 axillary metastasis

questions.text: A patient scheduled for a thyroid radionuclide scan had consumed an Iodine 123 containing pill at around 6 AM. What is the half-life of this drug?
A patient who was admitted after a road traffic accident is put on mechanical ventilation. He opens his eyes on verbal command and moves all four limbs spontaneously. Calculate his GCS.
The components of the Revised Trauma Score (RTS) include which of the following: 1. Glasgow coma scale 2. Respiratory Rate 3. Pulse Rate 4. Systolic BP 5. Mechanism of Injury
eFAST is least helpful in diagnosing which of the following conditions?

A 16-year-old male presents to the emergency department with sudden-onset severe testicular pain and swelling. On examination, the affected testicle is high-riding, tender, and has a horizontal lie. The cremasteric reflex is absent. Which of the following statements about the condition is false?

options.label: B
options.text: The right testis is likely to be positioned higher in the scrotal compartment.

options.label: C
options.text: If torsion is confirmed, the recommended treatment involves administering antibiotics and analgesics and performing immediate corrective surgery.

options.label: D
options.text: If torsion is confirmed, the recommended treatment involves administering antibiotics and analgesics and scheduling corrective surgery after 14 days.

questions.correct_answer: D. If torsion is confirmed, the recommended treatment involves administering antibiotics and analgesics and scheduling corrective surgery after 14 days.

questions.text: A newborn baby is examined shortly after birth and is found to have a visible bladder on the anterior abdominal wall. The bladder is exposed and not covered by the abdominal wall. The baby is otherwise healthy, and there are no other apparent abnormalities. What is the most likely diagnosis?

During a major earthquake, a triage officer is responsible for assessing and prioritizing patients based on their medical needs. Several injured individuals are brought to the triage area simultaneously. Which patient should be prioritized for immediate medical attention?

options.label: A
options.text: A conscious patient with a deep leg laceration, bleeding profusely.

options.label: B
options.text: An unconscious patient with no visible external injuries.

options.label: C
options.text: A conscious patient with a fractured arm and complaining of severe pain.

options.label: D
options.text: An unconscious patient with an open head injury and bleeding from the nose.

questions.correct_answer: A. A conscious patient with a deep leg laceration, bleeding profusely.

questions.text: A patient presents following a motorcycle road traffic accident. There was no pain or injury. Examination shows blood at the tip of the urethral meatus. What will be your next step in management?
A patient was found to have a mass arising from the antrum of the stomach which involves the head of the pancreas and metastasis to the right lobe of the liver. How will you manage this patient?
questions.correct_answer: A. Palliative gastrojejunostomy followed by chemotherapy

questions.text: An alcoholic patient presented with severe abdominal pain. Pancreatitis was suspected and a CT scan revealed echoic lesions with fluid collected near the body of the pancreas. Which of the following enzymes is most likely to be elevated?
A young man gets into a fight after taking beer and is kicked by the lower abdomen. There was pelvic fracture. Blood at meatus. Most likely cause is:
When a ‘spontaneous perforation’ of the esophagus occurs as a result of severe barotrauma while a person vomits against a closed glottis, the condition is known as:

A 60-year-old chronic smoker presented with progressive jaundice, pruritus and clay colored stools for 2 months. History of waxing and waning of jaundice was present. A CT scan revealed dilated main pancreatic duct and common bile duct. What is the likely diagnosis?
In a burn patient, the doctor is looking for curling ulcer. Which part should be examined?

options.label: D
options.text: Junction between 2nd and 3rd part of duodenum

questions.text: Most common complication of ileostomy is:
A 45 years old patient presented to you with ongoing massive hematemesis. The patient is alert and hemodynamically stable. What will be the first step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Do an urgent upper GI endoscopy

options.label: B
options.text: Put the patient in recovery position and secure airway

options.label: C
options.text: Insert a cannula and start IV fluids

questions.correct_answer: B. Put the patient in recovery position and secure airway

questions.text: Acute cellular rejection following solid organ transplantation occurs:

options.label: A
options.text: Within minutes to hours of transplantation

questions.correct_answer: C. Between 5 to 30 days of transplantation

questions.text: According to Weigert-Meyer’s rule of duplication of ureter, the lower pole ureter in urinary bladder is:

options.label: A
options.text: Lateral and cephalad to the upper pole ureter

options.label: B
options.text: Lateral and caudal to the upper pole ureter

options.label: C
options.text: Medial and cephalad to the upper pole ureter

options.label: D
options.text: Medial and caudal to the upper pole ureter

questions.correct_answer: A. Lateral and cephalad to the upper pole ureter

questions.text: Hesselbach’s triangle is bounded by the following, except:
The most common neuroendocrine tumor of the pancreas is:
ASEPSIS wound scoring takes all of the following into consideration except:
A patient comes with long-standing non-pitting edema in the legs. What is the most probable cause?
Which of the following should be the treatment of choice for renal cell carcinoma with tumor less than 4 cm in size?
Germline mutations of which of the following genes is not associated with hereditary pheochromocytoma?
What is the best method of management in a patient with recurrent episodes of multiple duct ectasia?

options.label: C
options.text: Wide excision involving the affected ducts

questions.text: Identify the following instrument:

A 4 month old child having complaints of high grade fever, decreased appetite and pain right hip. On examination he has dehydration, tenderness in scarpas triangle, swelling in right hip region/absent movements in right hip region. On X-ray there is mild increase in medial joint space. Most likely diagnosis is:
The shown brace is used in which condition:
In congenital dislocation of the hip (CDH), the pathological changes include the following except :

options.label: B
options.text: Snail flattened femoral head lying outside the acetabulum

options.label: D
options.text: Thickened adherent joint capsule with an hour-glass constriction.

questions.text: A 25 years- old male complained of limitation of wrist movements, especially dorsiflexion, and weakness of the hand, especially the grip. Examination revealed radial deviation of the hand with abnormal prominence of the ulna. He gave a history of a fall on the outstretched hand in children. The correct diagnosis is :

options.label: A
options.text: Rheumatoid arthritis of the wrist joint

questions.text: All lung carcinomas for diagnosis requires CECT thorax but MRI is useful in which of the following:

Technetium-99m labelled heat-denatured RBC’s are used to diagnose pathology in which of the following?
A 46-year-old-man presents with acute flank pain and hematuria. What is the most appropriate next imaging test?
In which of the following conditions will you not see eggshell calcification of lymph nodes?
Eye of tiger sign on MRI is seen in which of the following conditions?
A cystic lesion in the suprasellar region with calcification is seen on the MRI. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 58-year-old man is rushed to the ED with severe chest pain and is diagnosed with acute myocardial infarction. Which of the following can be used to assess the area of infarction in this patient?
What is the recommended dose limit of cumulative radiation exposure during pregnancy?
The following scan is of a young woman on oral contraceptives. The most likely diagnosis is:

A female patient came to the hospital with a history of relapsing, remitting, mildly itchy erythematous plaques over the scalp, sacral area, and knees. She has a history of joint pain and her nail changes are shown ,in the image below. What is your diagnosis?
Skin manifestations caused by the drug administered for amebic dysentery are due to:
A 30-year-old presented with flaccid bullae on her skin which are easy to rupture. The biopsy revealed a suprabasal split. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presented with the following itchy cutaneous lesions to the OPD. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old man complains of widespread pruritus for the past two weeks. The itching is particularly bad at night. He has no history of note and works in the local car factory. On examination he has noted to have a number of linear erythematous lesions in between his fingers. What is the most likely diagnosis?
All of the following changes are seen in pregnancy except:
A drop in fetal heart rate that typically last less than 2 minutes and usually associated with umbilical cord compression is called:
A G3P2, pregnant comes to your clinic at 18 weeks of gestation for genetic counseling. She has a history of two kids born with thalassemia major. Which test would you recommend now?
A pregnant woman is found to have excessive accumulation of amniotic fluid.Such polyhydramnios is likely to be associated with all of the following conditions except:
A female at 37 weeks of gestation has mild labour pains for 10 hours and cervix is persistently 1 cm dilated but non effaced. What will be the next appropriate management?
All of the following are included in first stage of labor except:
All of the following steps are recommended by WHO for preventing PPH except:

options.label: C
options.text: Delivery of placenta by controlled cord tracton

questions.text: Early cord clamping is indicated in all except:
Anticipated preterm delivery. Dose of dexamethasone given to mother is:
A case of gestational trophoblastic neoplasia is detected to have lung metastasis. She should be Staged as:
Which is the most common congenital abnormality in a baby of a diabetic woman?

A 27 year primigravida presents with pregnancy induced hypertension with blood pressure of 150/100 mm of Hg at 32 weeks of gestation with no other complications. Subsequently, her blood pressure is controlled on treatment. If there are no complications, the pregnancy should be terminated at:

A female of 36 weeks gestation presents with hypertension, blurring of vision and headache. Her blood pressure reading was 180/120 mm Hg and 174/110 mm Hg after 20 minutes. How will you manage the patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Admit the patient, start antihypertensives and continue pregnancy till term

options.label: C
options.text: Admit the patient, start antihypertensives, MgSO, and terminate the pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Admit oral antihypertensives and follow-up in outpatient department

questions.correct_answer: C. Admit the patient, start antihypertensives, MgSO, and terminate the pregnancy

questions.text: A pregnant lady is suffering from SLE. Which of the following autoantibodies would be responsible if her child has congenital heart block?
In cephalic presentation with well-flexed head [fully flexed head] the presenting diameter is:
Which of following is false regarding stein leventhal syndrome?
Which of the following is not the function of OC pills as a contraceptive?

A 52-year-old lady presents with constant leakage of urine and dysuria two weeks after a complicated total abdominal hysterectomy. A diagnosis of Vesicovaginal fistula is suspected. The most important test for the diagnosis is:

A lady with 7 weeks amenorrhea presented with slight vaginal spotting. Crown Rump Length was 5 mm with a well-formed gestational sac with a calculated gestational age of 5.6 weeks on TVS. What is the next line of management?
questions.correct_answer: B. Repeat TVS after one week

questions.text: A 38-year old lady in her 6th week of gestation is concerned about Down’s syndrome and enquires about noninvasive prenatal testing. When is the earliest that the test can be undertaken?

A 16-year-old girl presented with primary amenorrhea. On evaluation, her height is normal and the breast development is appropriate for her age. However, the axillary and pubic hair is sparse. On ultrasound, an absent uterus is noted. What is the likely diagnosis?
According to Caldwell and Moloy’s classification of the pelvis, convergent sidewalls are associated with:
Which of the following signs suggests magnesium sulfate toxicity?
A young woman came to the clinic requesting a post-coital pill. Which of the following would you prescribe?

A 75-year-old elderly female presents with a history of feeling a bulge in her vagina for the past several years. She reports worsening symptoms of pelvic pressure and discomfort. On examination, a protrusion is noted out of the vagina which is shown following. Most appropriate management is:

A 28-year-old woman presents with vaginal bleeding at 10 weeks gestation. On ultrasound, a “snowstorm” appearance with multiple cystic spaces and absence of fetal parts is noted within the uterine cavity. Her serum B-hCG levels are markedly elevated. Most appropriate next step in management:

A 30-year-old married woman came for an infertility evaluation. On performing further investigations, intramural fibroids of sizes 7x5cm and 5x3cm were seen at the right and left cornual ends of the uterus. Her husband's semen analysis was found to be normal. What is the appropriate management of this case?
A 28-year old pregnant woman came for a routine antenatal check-up in her second trimester. Four years back, she delivered 2 healthy full-term twins. What would her obstetric score be?
Antepartum hemorrhage due to abruption shows all except:
A woman presents at 8 weeks of gestation. Which of the following signs can be elicited at this gestation? 1. Goodell's sign 2. Osiander's sign 3. Internal ballottement 4. Lightening

A 2-week-old infant presents with persistent jaundice that began within the first 24 hours of life. On examination, the jaundice is conjugated, and the infant has acholic (pale) stools. Laboratory tests reveal elevated direct bilirubin and gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT). What is the most likely cause of these findings?

A young infant is brought to you with a suspected developmental delay. The child is intently looking at his own hands. You would consider referring this child to a specialist if this milestone persists after.
During the anthropometric evaluation, the height for age of a child is < - 2SD. This is most likely due to?
Which of the following milestones would you generally expect a 3 year old child to display?

A previously healthy term infant suddenly develops respiratory distress on day 3 of life. An echocardiogram reveals coarctation of the aorta. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for immediate stabilization of this infant?

Following a delivery complicated by shoulder dystocia, the baby is noted to have a deformity in the right upper limb. On inspection, the orthopedics JR notes an adducted, internally rotated arm and a pronated forearm. Which nerve roots are affected here?

A 5-year-old child presented with edema, oliguria, and frothy urine. He has no history of similar complaints. His urine was positive for 3+ proteinuria, no RBCs/WBCs, and no casts. His serum albumin was 2.4 gm/dL and serum creatinine was 0.5 mg/dL. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Congenital adrenal hyperplasia most commonly presents as
A newborn presented with a tuft of hair over the lumbosacral region. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is an X-linked disorder?

A child presents with cold feet and a history of wearing socks even in the summers. On examination, lower limb pulses are diminished as compared to the radial pulse. Prominent radio femoral delay is present. What is the underlying condition?

options.label: A
options.text: There is hypertrophy of ductus arteriosus.

options.label: B
options.text: Coarctation distal to the origin of the left subclavian artery

options.label: C
options.text: Supply is from posterior to anterior thoracic artery.

options.label: D
options.text: Collaterals develop to supply upper limb.

questions.correct_answer: B. Coarctation distal to the origin of the left subclavian artery

questions.text: A 3-hour-old neonate with apnea has been on bag and mask ventilation for the last 30 seconds. She has now started taking spontaneous breaths. The heart rate is still between 100 and 110/min. What is your next step?

A child presented with a history of loose stools with an increase in frequency for 4 days. On examination, he is drowsy, unable to feed, and skin on pinching goes back very slowly. According to the integrated management of neonatal and childhood illness (IMNCI), this child will be classified as having:
The most common pituitary adenoma diagnosed in childhood is:
The most common organism causing pneumonia in cystic fibrosis among the pediatric age group is:

A schizophrenic patient was started on an antipsychotic drug that decreased his hallucinations significantly. Three days after starting the medication, he developed torticollis and orofacio-lingual movements. What is your diagnosis?

An employee in a company is friends with everyone in his office. He goes to different parties every weekend and says he loves talking to new people. This trait is described under which dimension of personality?
Which of the following is the most appropriate definition of stress?

options.label: C
options.text: It is the body's response to anything that requires attention or action causing physical, emotional, or psychological strain.

questions.correct_answer: C. It is the body's response to anything that requires attention or action causing physical, emotional, or psychological strain.

questions.text: A 17-year-old adolescent suffers from bulimia nervosa and is very depressed. She is also suffering from insomnia and apathy. Which of the following medications should be avoided?

A 32-year-old woman has been taking medication (the name of which she does not remember) for her psychiatric condition. She complains of excessive thirst and urinating “all the time.” Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
